LanguageData.ArmLeft.label: Left Arm
LanguageData.ArmLeft.description: The utility slot. the asymmetry design of the walker frame makes it not have a full left arm, instead a rack that can attach tools or equipment.
LanguageData.ArmRight.label: Right Arm
LanguageData.ArmRight.description: The equipment slot. walker frame has a robotic arm for equipment holding and capable to do some complex duty.
LanguageData.Attachment.label: Attachment
LanguageData.Attachment.description: The attachment slot, also called the pack slot is located on the rear side of the walker frame, and has many useful modules from an additional power supply to the escape Pod launcher.
LanguageData.Core.label: Core
LanguageData.Core.description: The core slot of walker frame, which is the most important part of an operation-ready mech.
LanguageData.Head.label: Head
LanguageData.Head.description: The sensor module slot. not always a helmet but its located on the top of the body frame.
LanguageData.MountLeft.label: Left Mount
LanguageData.MountLeft.description: The ability gear slot, which can hold launchers or special device modules that can play a role beyond expectations in the right situation.
LanguageData.MountRight.label: Right Mount
LanguageData.MountRight.description: The right shoulder mount slot, it ususally capable to hold an automatic turret, or support a large pack with pack module.
